page.title: 07PIVINGTON MILL IND. UNITS
page.content: Pivington Mill was a working mill during the second world war making webbing belts and straps for military uniforms. The original buildings have now been converted into small industrial units which produce a wide variety of goods. These range from a small three man industry making garden furniture to an engineering works employing thirty people. The most recent addition to the site is a family run coach and mini-bus hire firm. The site originally housed the Manor of Pevington, which was held at the time of the original Domesday by Ralph de Curbespine on behalf of Odo, Bishop of Bayeux. Pevington Manor and its church of St. Mary's were passed into the Dering family of Surrenden and administered by them.
